title: Trafigura, a Key Oil-Trading Partner of Russia, Raises New Slug of Cash
sub_head: Commodities trader will be able to borrow the equivalent of $2.3 billion to cope with price volatility amid the Ukraine war
body:
Commodity giant Trafigura Group doubled the size of a credit facility with banks to more than $2 billion to weather extreme price moves sparked by the war in Ukraine.
Trafigura will be able to borrow the equivalent of $2.3 billion in different currencies, it said Wednesday, up from the $1.2 billion set out in early March. The company said it had raised the initial slug in record time to cope with the way the war had whipsawed markets.
